comment: Great Professor.  Hybrid class (in person and online).  Pretty easy, but lots of assignments.  Fair grading.
Straight forward class with clear requirements. Get your work done on time and you will do just fine.
Great Guy, loves what he does. I would recommend his class to anyone in the Macc program.

I took this online in the Fall. It's very straight forward. Online quizes and problems out of the book due every week. Very easy. XBRL paper was time consuming, he grades hard on formating and siting. Follow his outlines. Rivet software download only lasts one month so make sure complete XBRL assignment within the window. Overall, easy B, medium A.

Good guy to have a beer with, but he's a point nazi with a disturbing obsession with XBRL.  The content of the class comes secondary to the XBRL paper, even though technically there are more points from book assignments.  I ended up with an 89.8% overall in the class and he still gave me a B.  Not pleased in any way with that, but he's a nice guy.

I took the class over the summer (4 week session). This first day of class he decided to put everything online which was WONDERFUL! So from that point on everything was there tests and quizzes all open notes. One long paper took him no longer than 15 minutes to grade. Now that I am in other classes I am finding that I didnt learn what I need to.
Very easy class. Dr. Cappozzoli did get smart with me on serveral occassions. I would take him again, even though he is short at times.

Super nice guy!  However, after the 1st night of class he did not "teach" a thing!  We covered homework questions only.  All quizzes were taken prior to the topics being presented in class.  Very frustrating class!
